author: Staff Reporter
text:
In two chain-snatching incidents reported under Madurai city police limits on Friday evening, about seven sovereigns of gold jewellery were stolen.

One of the incidents was reported in Tirupparankundram police limits in which a 30-year-old woman fell victim. Police sources said that R. Mariammal (30), resident of Pasumpon Nagar in Tirupparankundram, had gone to a nearby market and was walking back home along with her husband.

When the two were walking in a dimly lit stretch of the road near Gandhi Nagar area, two strangers coming in a motorbike from behind snatched three sovereigns of gold chain Ms. Mariammal was wearing and sped away. On a complaint filed by her, Tirupparankundram police have registered a case.

A similar incident was reported in Anna Nagar police limits when three-and-a-half sovereigns of gold chain was snatched from an 18-year-old boy.

According to the complaint filed by the victim G. Ajay Ramachandran, residing on Bharathiyar Street, he had gone to meet a friend and was on his way back to his home. Before he could realize, two strangers coming from behind in a motorbike allegedly snatched the chain he was wearing and sped away. The Anna Nagar police have registered a case.
title: Chains snatched at two places
